beforeHooks.title: "before all" hook

tests.title: You should have made at least 2 git commits
tests.fullTitle: Git Checks You should have made at least 2 git commits

tests.title: Git should be configured with username and email information
tests.fullTitle: Git Checks Git should be configured with username and email information

tests.title: All changes in checked-in files should be committed to Git (OK for this to fail while you are still working)
tests.fullTitle: Git Checks All changes in checked-in files should be committed to Git (OK for this to fail while you are still working)
tests.code: expect(gitCheck.dirty, 'looks like you have changed some files and not committed the changes yet').to.equal(0);

tests.title: All files in current directory should be committed to Git (OK for this to fail while you are still working)
tests.fullTitle: Git Checks All files in current directory should be committed to Git (OK for this to fail while you are still working)
tests.code: expect(gitCheck.untracked, 'looks like you have some files in the directory which have not been added to the repository. \n      Make sure your answers do not rely on them, or tests will fail on the server.').to.equal(0);

tests.title: Text file with title yourGithubID.json should exist in "students" directory
tests.fullTitle: JSON Checks Text file with title yourGithubID.json should exist in "students" directory

tests.title: JSON file should be valid JSON -- please check quotation marks, colons, commas, etc.
tests.fullTitle: JSON Checks JSON file should be valid JSON -- please check quotation marks, colons, commas, etc.
tests.code:
let p = `students/${githubid}.json`;
expect(jlint(p), `Do your best to make sense of the error message below. If you have
created a syntax error, the debugger will try to find the mistake, but
often the error will only be detected several lines after its *actual*
source. Be on the lookout especially for mising quotation marks,
commas, braces ("{}"), etc. Often the *closing* parenthsis, brace, or
quotation mark will be missing and cause an error.

`).to.not.be.an('error');

tests.title: JSON file should contain name, email,github, and picture
tests.fullTitle: JSON Checks JSON file should contain name, email,github, and picture

tests.title: Image file with title yourGithubID.jpg should exist in "images" directory
tests.fullTitle: Image Checks Image file with title yourGithubID.jpg should exist in "images" directory

suites.title: Reflection Checks (not required unless you are attempting an "A" grade!)

tests.title: Reflection file should exist
tests.fullTitle: Reflection Checks (not required unless you are attempting an "A" grade!) Reflection file should exist
tests.code:
let r = `Reflection/${githubid}.md`;
expect(r, `I can't find the file ${r}`).to.be.a.file();

tests.title: The total word count for your reflection should be around 525 (give or take)
tests.fullTitle: Reflection Checks (not required unless you are attempting an "A" grade!) The total word count for your reflection should be around 525 (give or take)
